alert.note: Alert for Greene (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 2:02PM CDT until August 03 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Cocke, Grainger, Greene, Hamblen, Hawkins and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morristown, Greeneville, Bean Station, Tusculum, White Pine, Parrottsville, Russellville, Mosheim, Bulls Gap, Mohawk, Caney Branch, Cedar Creek, Bybee, Lowland, Camp Creek and Alpha. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
